item.title: China-PLP Trade | Si Ka Lon calls for improved services
item.description:
Recently re-elected deputy, Si Ka Lon questioned the Government about the “Conduct China-Portuguese Speaking Countries” service platform, asking for the service to improve, namely with the creation of a certification system, in order to take more local brands abroad
Deputy Si Ka Lon, recently elected indirectly by the industrial, commercial and financial sectors, sent a new question to the Executive in which he defends an improvement in services provided by the “China-Portuguese Speaking Countries Trade Conduct” platform, which aims to “provide a series of connection and support services to companies, institutions and individuals interested in exploring and developing the markets of China and Portuguese-speaking Countries”, such as “consultancy and business forwarding”, among other services. In the interpellation, Si Ka Lon questions the effectiveness of the services provided to date and asks for new support structures to be created. “Currently the ‘China-PLP Trade Conduct’ services focus on administrative issues and the provision of information, but the Government can study the launch of more advanced and attractive complementary measures, such as the establishment of an official certification regime”, he suggested. Si Ka Lon also added the idea of ​​creating a “brand incubation and advertising support” service, so that “the services are updated in order to give this platform a greater degree of training, to increase the attractiveness and competitiveness of local brands when they enter the foreign market”. The deputy linked to the Fujian community wants to know what strategies the Government has in place to attract high-value brands to the Macau market and how the local market can be taken advantage of to explore foreign markets. Incubators needed Si Ka Lon highlighted that, taking into account the situation of “dual circulation” of goods and services with the country and China's strategy of opening up to the outside world, it can lead to the efficient performance of Macau's specific advantages in supporting brands of excellence in Mainland China, so that they can have a greater presence in international markets. The deputy considers this to be an essential means for Macau to diversify its economy and explore new points of growth. As for the incubation of local brands, the deputy wants to know more details. Si Ka Lon recalled that the Government said that the China-Portuguese-Speaking Countries Limited Partnership Cooperation and Development Fund would be carrying out a study and visiting local companies with a view to exploring their degree of excellence, especially companies that start business with Portuguese-speaking countries. "What are the plans and ideas? How will a closer connection be established with associations and industrial entities so that coordinated development can be implemented between brands from Macau and mainland China to enter the foreign market?", he asked.

item.title: Macau | Public accounts with losses in September
item.description: Macau's public accounts reveal that the region lost 57.4 million patacas in September, after a budget review to reinforce social support. According to data published online by the Financial Services Directorate (DSF), the territory recorded a surplus in public accounts of 14.8 billion patacas in the first nine months of the year. However, this value represents a drop of 0.39 percent compared to the end of August, when Macau had a surplus of 14.9 billion patacas. Even so, the surplus between January and September was 3 percent higher than in the same period last year and is already more than double the Government's initial forecast for the entire year 2025: 6.83 billion patacas. Macau closed 2024 with a surplus of 15.8 billion patacas, more than double that recorded in the previous year. The loss recorded in September was due to public expenditure, which increased by 18.6 percent in just one month, reaching 68.2 billion patacas. The main reason for this increase was spending on social support and subsidies, which grew by practically a quarter (24.9 percent) compared to August, to 38.7 billion patacas. At the beginning of July, the Macau parliament approved a Government proposal to increase the expenses foreseen in the budget by 2.86 billion patacas, to reinforce social support. The review includes the creation of a subsidy, worth a total of MOP54,000, for children up to three years old, in an attempt to increase the lowest birth rate in the world. Spending on the Administration's Investment and Expense Plan also rose 11.9 percent compared to August, to 12.3 billion patacas. The increase in expenditure was balanced by Macau's current revenue, which rose 1.6 percent in the first nine months of the year, to 82.6 billion patacas. The main reason for the increase was a 6 percent increase, to 70.4 billion patacas, in revenue from gambling taxes – which represent 85.2 percent of the total. The city's six gaming operators pay a direct tax of 35 percent on gaming revenue, with 2.3 percent going to the Macau Social Security Fund and urban and tourism development, and 1.6 percent given to the Macau Foundation for cultural, educational, scientific, academic and philanthropic purposes. Total revenue from Macau's casinos reached 181.3 billion patacas in the first nine months of the year, 7.1 percent more than in the same period of 2024.

item.title: SAFP | New limits on management positions
item.description: The Executive Council concluded the discussion of an administrative regulation that will impose new limits on the level of leadership positions in the Administration and Public Service Services. According to the legal diploma, which is not fully known, when a service has less than 200 people, the number of management positions and internal service subunits is limited to two management positions, two department-level subunits and four division-level subunits. If the service has between 200 and 1,000 people, it is limited to three management positions, six department-level subunits, and twelve division-level subunits. Finally, if it is made up of more than 1,000 people, the limits are four management positions, eight department-level subunits and 16 division-level subunits. Only the Chief Executive can exempt services from respecting this legal limit. The new regulation replaces the 1984 decree-law that regulates the organic structure of public services. Justice Affairs | Official Press integrated into the Services The Official Press (IO) will be integrated into the Directorate of Justice Affairs Services (DSAJ). The announcement was made by the Executive Council on Friday. According to the official version, the decision was taken taking into account the “reform of Public Administration”, “the simplification of the organic structure” and is the result of “a new review and analysis of the current functions and structures” of the two services. With this integration, the Executive hopes to reorganize and simplify “the organic structures of the two service departments”. After the merger, DSAJ will be responsible for the previous functions, including study of general justice policy, legislative coordination, legislative production and related technical support, legal dissemination, publication of the Official Bulletin of the Macau Special Administrative Region and printing of work necessary for the operation of the Macao SAR Government.

item.title: The Pat Sin Leng Fire
item.description:
On the 10th, it became known through the Hong Kong media that an eight-year-old child had made three calls to the police claiming that there was a fire in Pat Sin Leng, Tai Po, and that 25 teachers and students were trapped on the mountain. After the alert, the police, together with the Agriculture and Fisheries department and the Fire Department, arrived at the scene and verified that there was no fire. The boy was later located, admitted that he had lied and received a verbal warning. Although this incident is nothing more than a trivial matter, unlikely to arouse public concern, it does not fail to awaken painful memories. The phrase “there is a fire in Pat Sin Leng” evokes memories of the accident that occurred 30 years ago. On February 10, 1996, four teachers from Fung Yiu King Memorial School in Hong Kong accompanied a group of Year 7 and 8 students on a hike in Pat Sin Leng. It is suspected that the fire started because someone threw a burning cigarette into the bush. The fire spread across the mountain and the way down was blocked, forcing everyone to climb. Due to the difficulties of the terrain, they had to climb the “Maliu Cliff” rock to escape. Two teachers stayed behind to help the students climb the cliff. Thirty-two managed to return to the starting point to seek help. After helping most of the young people, the two teachers were unable to climb the cliff and died in the fire along with two students. In this incident, two teachers and three students died and thirteen were injured. Another hiker, who had helped rescue some of the fire victims, later self-imposed, possibly due to suffering from post-traumatic stress. In 1996, the Court ruled that the cause of the accident was “undoubtedly human”, but it was not clear whether it was due to a poorly extinguished cigarette or a fire that may have been lit as a joke. To honor the sacrifice of the two teachers, the Hong Kong Government had a pavilion erected in their memory in Pat Sin Leng, called “Spring Breeze Pavilion,” which means “good teachers” in Chinese.” Inside the pavilion, bilingual inscriptions in Chinese and English recount the entire incident. Two Buddhist pine trees were planted in front of the pavilion, in honor of the two teachers. A plaque commemorating the Spring Breeze Pavilion is placed at the entrance to Fung Yiu King Memorial School. Memorial services are held annually to share the events with students. The Fung Yiu King Memorial School has partnered with the Chinese University of Hong Kong to create a scholarship in memory of the two teachers named after them. The boy's lie undoubtedly rekindled painful memories. These memories should disappear over time instead of remaining in people's memories. Let's hope the lies end here and never resurface. May the painful memories be carried away by the wind. The spirit of the two teachers who sacrificed themselves for others lives on in Hong Kong society and is celebrated by all. We need to ask: why do we celebrate altruism? Is it because we only have one life, so when someone sacrifices themselves for others they deserve respect? The answer is not that simple. We only have one life and after death there is nothing more. The reason for celebrating self-sacrifice for the benefit of others is a way of celebrating the fact that someone capable of this act is completely devoid of selfishness, someone who only wants the good of others. This is a pure manifestation of love for humanity. If those who have been saved can continue to pass on this love, selfishness will decrease and genuine friendship will increase. With this kind of unifying love, there will naturally be no hostility, because love brings together. In this sense, love can promote a more peaceful and harmonious society and everyone will be happy. In today's complex society, human hearts are unpredictable. Even if we want to bring our love to others, it is not always accepted. This is undoubtedly a harsh reality. The students who were injured in Pat Sin Leng, and who faced many trials, must certainly have left those bad times behind, strived to live their lives and start a new chapter, but at the same time they must have remembered the two teachers who saved them. Their ability to sacrifice on behalf of students is not only worthy of imitation, but it is a lesson that must be learned and passed on. Only love can unite us all in a selfless way. It has been thirty years since the Pat Sin Leng fire, but time will not fade the memory of the sincere and selfless love that these two teachers gave to their students. Through today's news, let us once again silently pay tribute to them. May they live happily in the Afterlife, and may the love they had for their students continue to be transmitted forever.
Legal Consultant of the Association for the Promotion of Jazz in Macau Associate Professor at the Faculty of Management Sciences of the Macau Polytechnic University Email: cbchan@mpu.edu.mo

item.title: Spinumviva “kills” Montenegro
item.description: Luís Montenegro's family business Spinumviva has been making waves for many months. All the media has announced the most diverse suspicions about the activity and management of the current Prime Minister's family company. The family business was made up of Montenegro, his wife and two children. It has already been designated as a consultancy, real estate, resource management company and who knows what else. What came to light is that hundreds of thousands of euros were entered into the family company's account in contracts with economic groups and other companies, such as Solverde, owner of casinos and potential competitor in the new competition for awarding licenses for casinos. Montenegro started to be talked about because he had a house in ruins, in Espinho, which he transformed into a luxury property with the city's privileged contractor, where the mayor president was a close friend of Montenegro. Meanwhile, as Montenegro had not declared all of its assets to the Transparency Entity, totaling 55 properties, the Public Prosecutor's Office (MP) decided to initiate a preventive investigation (?) into the activity of the company in question, particularly the construction of the aforementioned house in Espinho and the origin of the funds for the acquisition of two apartments in Lisbon carried out by Montenegro. The Public Prosecutor's Office understood that the case can only be clarified in criminal proceedings that will have to be formally opened in the Supreme Court of Justice. The MP even made it known that the case should be passed on to a judicial investigation as it included suspicions against Montenegro that included improper receipt of benefits and money laundering. Remember, for much less, a Government fell just because the Attorney General's Office decided to insert a paragraph in a statement that stated that Prime Minister António Costa could be under investigation. However, the cases and cases of Spinumviva, the family company from Montenegro, have come to the fore for a variety of reasons. One of them, because Montenegro has provided the Transparency Entity and the MP with documentation requested from the “mouthwashes”… One of the questions raised by several television commentators relates to the denial of the current Attorney General of the Republic, Amadeu Guerra, appointed by Prime Minister Luís Montenegro, that he has not yet given the green light to investigators to move from a preventive investigation (something that is neither flesh nor fish) to a judicial inquiry, similar to what has happened with many others who were quickly contacted by different politicians and presidents of football clubs. Amadeu Guerra's Prosecutor's Office issued a statement, which read that “the preventive investigation into the Spinumviva case is ongoing and that the MP is still awaiting documentation” requested from Montenegro. And what reason does Montenegro have for not sending the documentation quickly? But last week, in the middle of the electoral campaign for the local elections, another “bomb” went off regarding Montenegro. The media continued to report that Montenegro had gone on vacation to Brazil and that all expenses had been paid by Spinumviva. Wow, another “little thing” that led opposition political leaders to speak out, from André Ventura (Chega) to José Luís Carneiro (PS). And what did Montenegro respond? That everything was “a bit of a shame”. Whose shame? The media that has the obligation to inform? Little shame on the MP for breaking court secrecy and dropping the news on CNN Portugal, because investigators were fed up with Montenegro's attitude and Amadeu Guerra's orders? Or little shame in going on vacation with everything paid for by a family company that claims to be just a consultancy company? PAN spokesperson, Inês Sousa Real, for example, went public to regret yet another suspicion regarding the Prime Minister, stressing that “we do not want to believe that the times of Justice are the times of electoral campaigns, we do not align with this narrative like the one in which the Prime Minister has been justifying what has been the scrutiny throughout this process”. Much further went Paulo Raimundo, leader of the PCP, who clearly called for the prime minister's resignation. Raimundo even seemed to know something confidential about the government hosts, because, in fact, the replacement of Montenegro by Leitão Amaro or Paulo Rangel had already been considered. For our part, we do not believe that Montenegro will resign. Only if a criminal case is opened on all suspicions and the conclusion of the investigation will it be decided to give Montenegro a trial in court. Today, my reading friends already know the results of the local elections and if the AD allied with the Liberal Initiative (IL) won the elections, then, in that case, I am sure that Montenegro will not resign even if the Santa Justa elevator falls… The Prime Minister cannot escape the popular judgment that is beginning to sentence him as a case similar to that of José Sócrates. The people have already concluded that Montenegro did not comply with the laws, that something happened in the context of corruption and money laundering, that the Prime Minister only promises an increase in pensions and salaries during the election campaign, that he brought forward the delivery of the State Budget so that in the middle of the election campaign he could announce that the minimum wage would be close to one thousand euros. Of all the turns Montenegro takes in billiards, there is one thing that no longer saves him. His family company Spinumviva has already “killed” him politically in the eyes of the people.

item.title: Calm in the heart of the storm
item.description: On September 23rd, late in the afternoon, Super Typhoon “Ragasa” approached Macau and the Meteorological and Geophysical Services Directorate issued a typhoon signal number 8, however, everywhere calm reigned. Perhaps this was a unique phenomenon that preceded the storm, because what followed would test the tenacity of the people of Macau. In the direct elections for the Legislative Assembly, which took place on September 14th, thanks to the strong appeal of the Chief Executive and the constant efforts of the heads of government departments, the majority of public servants responded to the call and fulfilled their “duty” to vote. With the active cooperation of the largest operators in the gaming industry and the vigorous outreach of the candidate list campaign teams, the combined votes of the six candidate lists running in the direct elections to the Legislative Assembly this time far exceeded the votes obtained by the 14 candidate lists in 2021, resulting in a higher voter turnout in 2025 than in previous elections. Furthermore, there were surprising results: the incumbent deputy José Pereira Coutinho managed to be re-elected and his list came out ahead with 43,367 votes. At the same time, 5,987 blank votes and 7,053 invalid votes were recorded in these elections, setting a record for blank votes and invalid votes since Macau's return to Chinese sovereignty. When we analyze the results of direct elections we must opt ​​for a pragmatic approach. For example, the calculation of voter turnout cannot be based solely on the number of voters. In 2001, 159,813 voters were registered and voter turnout was 52.34 percent. In 2025, 328,506 voters were already registered and voter turnout was 53.35 percent. Comparing with voter turnout of 58.39 percent in 2005, 59.91 percent in 2009, 55.02 percent in 2013 and 57.22 percent in 2017, the 2025 result was the third lowest, but still significantly higher than the 42.38 percent that followed the first incident of candidate disqualification. direct elections to the Legislative Assembly in 2021. The 7,053 invalid votes represented a percentage of 4.02 percent and, although in percentage terms it is lower than that recorded in 2009, where 6,498 invalid votes corresponded to 4.36 percent of the vote, it is the highest ever in absolute terms. With only six candidate lists in 2025, the chance of voters filling out the form incorrectly is no greater than in 2009, when there were 16 candidate lists. Unfortunately, the invalid votes in 2025 were not publicly disclosed as in previous elections, leaving the population unable to understand why these votes were considered invalid. According to Article 26 of the Macao SAR Basic Law, “permanent residents of the Macau Special Administrative Region have the right to elect and be elected, in accordance with the law”. While Article 95 of the “Electoral Law for the Legislative Assembly of the Macao SAR” stipulates that “suffrage constitutes a right and a civic duty”, but does not specify how this civic duty must be fulfilled. The recently added Article 167-A stipulates that “anyone who publicly encourages voters not to vote, vote blank or invalid, is punished with a prison sentence of up to 3 years”. In Macau, voting is not mandatory like in Australia and Argentina. The chairman of the Electoral Affairs Committee of the Legislative Assembly, Mr. Seng Ioi Man, publicly stated after consulting the Administration and Civil Service Bureau, – if a civil servant does not vote for any reason, no disciplinary action will be taken against him in accordance with the Macao SAR Public Service Legal Regime. Voting is a civic right, which is logically different from the concept of “duty”. A right presupposes freedom of choice, while a “duty” implies a moral and legal obligation. And as in Macau public servants are not required to vote, your vote is an entirely personal choice. Just as Macau's Basic Law guarantees residents the right to strike, this does not imply that they are obliged to participate in strikes. The high number of votes obtained by List 2 – NOVA ESPERAÇÃO can certainly be attributed to the response of many public servants to the Government's call for “fulfillment of civic duty”. Regardless of the intensity of the typhoon, it is expected that people's lives will soon return to normal, with the combined efforts of the Macao SAR Government and the population. However, after another incident of disqualification of candidates for the 2025 direct elections to the Legislative Assembly, how many choices will voters have in the direct elections to the Legislative Assembly in 2029? Furthermore, the first arrest related to safeguarding national security took place in Macau. The detainee's surname is Au and he will be tried. How to enjoy peace in the heart of the storm is a profound exercise in political philosophy.

item.title: Peace for Ukraine
item.description: "The test of politics is how it ends, not how it begins. Peace must reflect reality, not illusion." Henry Kissinger Ukraine, as a candidate country for the European Union (EU), represents one of the greatest challenges and opportunities in the recent history of the European project. The war between Russia and Ukraine, which began in 2022, represents one of the most serious armed conflicts on European soil since World War II. Its consequences are devastating with thousands of deaths, millions of displaced people, destroyed cities, collapsed economies and a deep geopolitical divide between East and West. Peace, although desired by many, continues to seem like a distant horizon. However, history teaches that even the most prolonged and violent conflicts can find resolution, provided there is political will, effective mediation and a solid diplomatic architecture. To understand the possibilities for peace, it is necessary to revisit the root causes of the conflict. The war did not start in 2022, but has historical, identity and geopolitical roots that date back to the dissolution of the Soviet Union. Ukraine, by asserting its sovereignty and moving closer to Euro-Atlantic structures, has become, in Moscow's eyes, a strategic territory in dispute. The annexation of Crimea in 2014 and Russian support for the separatist republics of Donetsk and Lugansk were the first signs of an escalation that would culminate in a full invasion. Russia justifies its action with arguments of security, protection of Russian-speaking populations and resistance to NATO expansion. Ukraine, in turn, defends its right to self-determination, territorial integrity and the choice of its allies. This antagonism is fueled by divergent historical narratives, strategic interests and deep mutual distrust. Any peace process will have to face these roots, recognize them and find ways to overcome them without denying the sovereignty of each State. Peace between Russia and Ukraine faces several obstacles, firstly, territorial occupation, as the Russian military presence in Ukrainian territory, including Crimea and parts of Donbass, is one of the main obstacles. Ukraine demands the full withdrawal of occupying forces as a condition of any agreement. Russia, in turn, considers Crimea an integral part of its territory and sees Donbass as a zone of legitimate influence. Secondly, international recognition, as the international community, in particular Western countries, supports Ukraine and imposes sanctions on Russia. This polarization makes mediation difficult and reinforces block logic. Peace requires a neutral diplomatic space, where both parties can negotiate without excessive external pressure. Thirdly, the human losses and collective traumas as the war generated deep wounds in Ukrainian society. The destruction of cities, massacres, bombings and forced displacement have created a feeling of pain and anger that cannot be ignored. Reconciliation requires justice, memory and reparation. Fourth, political leadership and internal narratives, as in both Russia and Ukraine, political leaders have constructed narratives that make compromise difficult. Peace can be seen as weakness, as betrayal or as capitulation. It is necessary to create conditions so that leaders can negotiate without losing internal legitimacy. Despite the obstacles, there are factors that can favor the construction of a peace process, first of all, war fatigue as the prolongation of the conflict generates economic, social and political exhaustion. Russia faces sanctions, isolation and internal difficulties. Ukraine lives in a permanent state of emergency. Fatigue can open space for negotiated solutions. Second, international pressure, as Organizations such as the United Nations, the OSCE and neutral countries can play a mediation role. Multilateral diplomacy, when well structured, can create bridges and facilitate compromises. Third, historical experiences as Europe has examples of reconciliation after intense conflicts such as Germany and France after World War II, the peace agreements in Northern Ireland and German reunification. These models show that peace is possible, even between historical enemies. Fourth, civil society and culture, together with education, can be drivers of rapprochement. Dialogue, exchange and symbolic reconstruction projects can prepare the ground for political peace. Peace between Russia and Ukraine can take different forms depending on the evolution of the conflict and negotiations. So there is first to consider conditional peace with a ceasefire accompanied by negotiations on territories, security and international guarantees. This model requires mutual commitments and may include demilitarized zones, observation missions and non-aggression agreements. Second, peace with partial recognition with an agreement in which Ukraine recognizes the loss of certain territories in exchange for security guarantees and reconstruction support. This model is controversial and can generate internal divisions, but it has been applied in other contexts. Third, peace as international mediation, in which the creation of an international peace conference, with the participation of neutral countries, multilateral organizations and representatives of civil society. This model allows for a more comprehensive and less polarized approach. Fourth, peace in stages with a gradual process, with phases of de-escalation, reconstruction, transitional justice and regional integration. This model requires time, patience and long-term commitment. For peace to be lasting, it is necessary to fulfill certain conditions, firstly, respect for sovereignty, as Ukraine must maintain the right to decide its future, its allies and its political model. Russia must recognize this right and commit to non-interference. Second, justice and reparation as crimes committed during the war must be investigated and punished. Victims must be recognized and compensated. Justice is essential for reconciliation. Third, peace must include security guarantees for both countries, with verification mechanisms, military dialogue and cooperation in areas such as arms control. Fourth, Ukraine needs financial, technical and institutional support to rebuild the country. Russia, in turn, must find ways to reintegrate into the global economy, as long as it respects the principles of international law. Fifth, education for peace as it is not built only with treaties. It is necessary to invest in education, culture and memory, so that new generations understand the value of dialogue and coexistence. The EU, the United States, China and other powers have responsibilities in promoting peace. Europe, in particular, must take an active role, not just as an ally of Ukraine, but as a mediator and promoter of lasting solutions. Peace cannot be imposed but must be built on the basis of mutual respect, justice and cooperation. The international community must avoid the temptation to turn Ukraine into a protracted battleground between blocs. The objective must be reconstruction, stability and dignity of the people. Thus, peace between Russia and Ukraine is possible, but it requires courage, vision and commitment. It will not be a quick or simple process. Wounds are deep, interests are complex, and emotions are intense. The alternative is acceptable to the perpetuation of war. History shows that even the most violent conflicts can find resolution. Europe, which was the scene of so many wars, can also be the space for reconciliation. Peace is not just an agreement but a collective construction, made up of gestures, words, policies and memories. Ukraine and Russia have the right to exist, to prosper and to live in security. Peace between them will be a sign of political maturity, respect for life and hope for the future. It is up to leaders, societies and the international community to transform this horizon into reality.

item.title: “Halftone 25” | Photography exhibition opens today at FRC
item.description: The Rui Cunha Foundation (FRC) presents today, starting at 6:30 pm, the Collective Photographic Exhibition “Halftone’ 25”, which brings together the annual works of 23 amateur and professional artists, members of Halftone — Macau Photographic Association, curated by Gonçalo Lobo Pinheiro and Francisco Ricarte. The collective exhibition reveals a total of 23 works, ranging from documentary photography to artistic expression, including landscape, human, studio, conceptual, “street photography”, color or black-and-white photography. As in previous years, images were selected, some already known and others new, by authors such as André Carvalhosa, António Mil-Homens, António Sotero, António Bessa Almeida, Cássia Schutt, Catarina Cortesão Terra, Carmen Serejo, Cristiana Figueiredo, David Lopo, Elói Scarva, Francisco Ricarte, Gonçalo Lobo Pinheiro, Inela Kovacevic, Joana Freitas, João Miguel Barros, João M. Rato, João Palla Martins, Jorge Veiga Alves, José das Neves, José Sales Marques, Kuok Hou Tang, Nélson Silva and Nuno Calçada Bastos. Halftone is a non-profit cultural association created in 2021, based in Macau, which aims to promote contemporary photography in all its aspects. Founded in an inclusive and comprehensive way, it is open to all those interested in photography as an artistic or documentary expression, regardless of their experience or practice. In addition to boosting the photographic work of its members, Halftone also aims to organize exhibitions, publish a magazine, books and monographs, organize debates and develop pedagogical and educational projects. This exhibition will be on display until October 25th, 2025.

item.title: FIMM | Thomas Hampson plays Mahler this week on CCM
item.description: This Thursday, the 16th, the world-renowned baritone Thomas Hampson will perform in Macau, who will perform songs by Gustav Mahler for another concert as part of the 37th edition of the Macau International Music Festival. “Thomas Hampton Sings Mahler” also features German pianist Wolfgang Rieger It is another highlight of the 37th edition of the Macau International Music Festival (FIMM): this Thursday, October 16th, Thomas Hampson, protagonist of the concert “Thomas Hampton Sings Mahler”, takes to the stage in the large auditorium of the Macau Cultural Center (CCM). Accompanying him, from 8pm, will be the German pianist Wolfgang Rieger. This is a show dedicated to the “lieder” [set of compositions] by Gustav Mahler, conductor and composer born in 1860, in Bohemia, and considered one of the great names of the romantic period of classical music. The “lieder” include the song cycle “Des Knaben Wunderhorn (The Young Man’s Magic Horn)”, composed and revised between 1892 and 1901; and also the cycle of old songs “Lieder und Gesänge aus der Jugendzeit”, composed between 1880 and 1889, “illuminating the intricate poetry and complex psychological landscapes that define Mahler's art”. Furthermore, the concert program “offers a thematic journey through Mahler’s ‘Wunderhorn’ and ‘Lieder und Gesänge’ settings”, compositions “grouped into three chapters – ‘Fables and Parables’, ‘Humoresques and Ballads’ and ‘Ballads and Allegories'”, and which “trace a progression from pastoral charm and satire to existential depth and longing metaphysical.” In this way, “the public will also have the opportunity to experience a mixture of life's wisdom and esteemed musicality through the sound of his voice at the age of 70”, describes a note from the Cultural Institute (IC). Study and awards The baritone's career is full of distinctions. The IC describes that “Thomas Hampson dedicated decades to the performance, communication and academic study of Mahler's art, earning a reputation as a 'singer-scholar'”. Furthermore, “he obtained multiple honorary doctorates and received numerous international awards, including the Grammy Award, the Edison Award, or the ‘Grand Prix du Disque'”. Thomas Hampson has also received “numerous international honors for his unique artistry and cultural leadership, fully reflecting his illustrious status in classical music circles”, having a repertoire “composed of more than 80 roles, and with a discography including more than 170 albums”. Thomas Hampton is also honorary professor of Philosophy at the University of Heidelberg and honorary member of the Royal Academy of Music in London. He holds the prestigious title of “Kammersänger of the Wiener Staatsoper” and was named “Commander of the Order of Arts and Letters” by the French Republic. He is also co-founder and artistic director of the Lied Academy Heidelberg and, in 2003, founded the Hampsong Foundation, through which he uses the art of song to promote intercultural dialogue and understanding. Happy partnership Another of the musicians who takes the CCM stage, Wolfram Rieger, is a distinguished German pianist, recognized for his interpretation of “Lied”. He perfected his art in classes with Elisabeth Schwarzkopf, Hans Hotter and Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau. After completing his studies, Rieger began teaching at the Munich Higher School of Music, where he founded his own Lieder class for singers and pianists in 1991. He has been Professor of “Lied” at the Hanns Eisler School of Music in Berlin since 1998, and gives masterclasses all over the world. Much sought after as a recital partner and chamber musician, Rieger performs in renowned venues such as Wigmore Hall, Carnegie Hall, the Konzerthaus in Vienna and at festivals such as the Schubertiade in Feldkirch and Salzburg. His collaborators include Thomas Hampson, Thomas Quasthoff, Brigitte Fassbaender and Matthias Goerne. His renowned recordings earned him distinctions such as the Hugo Wolf Medal and the Medal of the Franz Schubert Association of Barcelona. Ticket prices for this recital vary between 150 and 400 patacas.

item.title: Macau and Hong Kong receive work by Carlos Paredes next year
item.description: Carlos Paredes' work will be on a world tour, visiting 15 countries, starting from Monday, over the course of six months, a project with the concept and artistic direction of musicians André Varandas and Bruno Costa. The “Paredes Experience” project includes a total of 40 initiatives, which include the “100 Paredes” concerts, lectures, meetings with schools and universities, and other actions with Portuguese communities around the world, promoting “the sound and spirit of Carlos Paredes”, André Varandas told the Lusa agency. "It is a rare event, for a Portuguese musical project to circulate for almost six months, uninterruptedly, across 15 countries. It is something that makes us very proud and with an added responsibility", he stressed. The piano and bass guitar of André Varandas are joined by the Portuguese guitar of Bruno Costa, the two mentors and performers of “Paredes Experience”, who, on stage, on the world tour, will also feature the collaboration of Nuno Botelho (classical guitar). The world tour opens today, in Guinea-Bissau, where it will remain until the 18th. An “artistic journey” The authors explained to Lusa that the “Paredes Experience” is “an artistic journey that reaffirms the Portuguese guitar as Portugal’s identity instrument and, simultaneously, proves its universal language”. “On stage, tradition and modernity intersect, evoking the legacy of Carlos Paredes and projecting it into the future through new sounds, cultural dialogues and multidisciplinary international collaborations”, they said. After Guinea-Bissau, the “Paredes Experience” heads to Dili, in Timor-Leste, where it will stay between the 21st and 30th of this month, flying to the east coast of the United States (USA), from the 6th to the 13th of November, with actions scheduled for New York, New Bedford and New Jersey. Between November 27th and December 4th, Argentina is the destination, with performances scheduled for the capital, Buenos Aires, and Córdoba, the second most populous city in that South American country. Montevideo, in Uruguay, will host the “Paredes Experience” between December 5th and 9th, before a first return to Europe, in this case to Italian Tuscany, in the towns of Pontedera and Buti (December 11th to 14th). At the beginning of 2026, Carlos Paredes' music will echo in Poland, between the 9th and 17th of January, then heading to China and the territories of Macau and Hong Kong, in locations yet to be announced, from the 19th to the 26th of the same month. The “Paredes Experience” world tour has its finale scheduled for São Paulo, Brazil, with initiatives scheduled from March 12th to 23rd. In the year that marks the centenary of the birth of Carlos Paredes (1925-2025), André Varandas and Bruno Costa promoted, in Portugal, the “100 Paredes” project, which proposed “a global celebration of the life and work of who is unanimously recognized as one of the greatest symbols of Portuguese culture and the universality of the Portuguese guitar”. In total, there were more than 80 initiatives including socio-community concerts, lectures and a traveling exhibition, among other actions.

item.title: Fireworks | Festival ends with UK victory
item.description:
The UK pyrotechnics team, Pyrotex Fireworx, emerged as the winner of the 33rd edition of the Macau International Fireworks Festival, which ended on Saturday. Highlight for the debut, at the close of the curtain, of a Brazilian team in the competition
The United Kingdom won the Macau International Fireworks Competition, which ended with a show from Brazil, which participated in the competition for the first time, the Tourism Services Bureau (DST) announced on Saturday. In a statement, DST revealed that participating companies from the Philippines and mainland China placed second and third, respectively, in the 33rd edition of the competition. The competition ended on Saturday, with two shows: the winner, from the British pyrotechnic company Pyrotex Fireworx, and another from the Vision Show team, from Florianópolis, in Santa Catarina, which marked Brazil's debut in the competition. The end of the competition, which was scheduled for October 6, was postponed due to the passage of Typhoon Matmo, which led Macau authorities to issue tropical storm signal 8, the third highest level. The third night of the contest also had to be postponed, from September 20th to October 2nd, due to the impact of super typhoon Ragasa, the most powerful storm recorded on the planet in 2025. A series of dialogues The director of DST, Maria Helena de Senna Fernandes, highlighted at the awards ceremony that, despite the impact of weather conditions, the event allowed companies from various parts of the world “to deepen contacts and dialogue with industry partners”. The 33rd edition featured 10 shows, each lasting 18 minutes, combining fireworks and music, including the show by the Portuguese company Pirotecnia de Barbeita, based in Monção. The competition had a budget of 18.1 million patacas, a figure that represents a drop of around 1.1 percent compared to last year, DST told Lusa. The six gaming operators in Macau, main partners of the contest, contributed 18 million patacas, with the Government contributing only 60 thousand patacas, said the same source. The competition partially coincided with China's National Day Golden Week (October 1), a holiday period that this year lasted eight days, one more than in 2024, thanks to the proximity of the Mooncake Festival (October 7). October's 'Golden Week' is the second largest mass movement in China, after the Lunar New Year period, the main traditional family festival, which takes place in January or February, depending on the lunar calendar. Macau received a total of 1.14 million visitors, 16.5 percent more than in the same period in 2024, including more than 191 thousand on the 4th of October alone, the highest daily figure for October's 'golden week'.

item.title: Works | Merchants on Rua dos Mercadores complain about the impact
item.description:
Despite planning and advance warnings from the Government, traders on Rua dos Mercadores believe that the new works are keeping customers away, raising dust and causing a lot of noise
Shopkeepers on Rua dos Mercadores complain that they are being affected by the works for the future installation of pipes. Work began last week, but stores report that they are already feeling that customers are avoiding that area. Speaking to the newspaper Ou Mun, a trader surnamed Chao stated that because of the inconvenience caused by the works, customers have no desire to go to stores or even frequent the area. Chao criticized the works due to the loud and frequent noise, as well as the dust raised by the excavations. The trader also criticized the signage at the location, and stated that some customers passing by were left with the idea that the streets were closed to pedestrians. In addition to the reduction in the number of customers, the complaints are about the fact that vehicles are no longer able to travel on the road. With vehicles unloading far from stores, materials need to be loaded. However, the process means that the store doors are left open, which means that construction dust penetrates the spaces and ends up affecting the entire interior. Although the Government has widened some sidewalks, Chao confessed that the widening has limited effects on the attractiveness of that street, because the sidewalks continue to be narrow. The ongoing works aim to install ducts so that, in the future, pipes can pass from other buildings, without the need to re-excavate the road. However, Chao considers that the work is not justified because it has no benefits for traders, only inconveniences. Therefore, the businessman hopes that the Government will financially support the affected businesses: “Instead of apologizing and understanding, given that we have no other choice, I prefer that they present support measures”, he stated. Evils for good The works were also criticized by a store worker named Cheong. This employee indicated that the work disturbs passers-by, making circulation on sidewalks more difficult, in addition to being carried out with incessant noise, which lasts throughout the day, and clouds of dust. However, Cheong considers that the work could be acceptable if it serves, as promised by the Government, to reduce the number of road interventions in the area. According to the Government, the execution of the works aims to open and install the ducts so that in the future it will be possible to make piping and drainage connections to four new buildings in that area, without the need to re-excavate the streets.

item.title: 929 Challenge | More than 400 Chinese and Portuguese-speaking teams
item.description: The online bootcamp of the 929 Challenge in Macau began yesterday, having attracted more than 400 teams and startups from China and Portuguese-speaking countries, an increase of more than 25 percent compared to 2024, the organization highlighted. The last edition of the competition for startups from China and Portuguese-speaking countries had recorded a maximum, with more than 1,600 participants in more than 320 teams. “This growing interest reflects the strengthening of connections between Portuguese-speaking countries and China's innovation ecosystems, progress that we are grateful to witness through continuous collaboration and shared learning between regions”, highlighted the organization, on the social network Instagram. Since yesterday and for two weeks, the 402 teams registered in the fifth edition will participate every day, in an online bootcamp from 7:00 pm to 9:00 pm. Until October 11th, the teams will have a series of lectures, mentoring sessions and workshops “designed to help teams shape, validate and strengthen sustainable business models”. The best 16 plans – eight from companies and eight from university students – will have 10 minutes to convince the 929 Challenge jury and potential investors in the final, on November 30th. The fifth edition of the 929 Challenge in Macau will include the 'Future Builders' award for the best startup in Portuguese-speaking African Countries (PALOP) and Timor-Leste. Partners and projects In June, during the presentation of the competition, Marco Duarte Rizzolio, co-founder of 929 Challenge, told Lusa that the prize was created to encourage participants from less developed Portuguese-speaking countries. In 2024, the 929 Challenge did not receive any projects from Timor-Leste or São Tomé and Príncipe. The Portuguese startup Iplexmed, which develops rapid genetic diagnostic devices, won last year's edition, while the also Portuguese NS2, which provides intelligent solutions to monitor water quality for sustainable aquaculture, came third. Bruno Ferreira, co-founder of Iplexmed, will be one of the mentors at this year's 'bootcamp'. The only time that a team from PALOP and Timor-Leste reached the finalists was in the first edition, launched in 2021, in the middle of the covid-19 pandemic, then only aimed at university students. A project by the Lusófona University of Guinea-Bissau to install solar panels in the Gabu region, in the east of the country, came in second place. “In the end, those who win are often teams that already have mature products and mature services”, explained Rizzolio. This year the competition has new partners, including StartupPorto, Cabo Verde Digital and Eduardo Mondlane University, in Mozambique. The competition is co-organized by the Forum for Economic and Trade Cooperation between China and Portuguese-speaking Countries (Macau) and several institutions in the Chinese special administrative region, including all local universities.

item.title: Customs | 21 people arrested for circulating books containing pornography
item.description: The Gongbei Customs Service says it has detained 21 people in two years for circulating 25,299 copies of books considered “obscene”, that is, with pornographic content. According to a statement from the authorities, three rounds of operations were carried out during this period of time to combat this type of crime, with the first action of its kind taking place on March 13, 2023. At that time, a cross-border driver was stopped trying to enter Macau through the Hengqin Border Post with 86 books in the car. Anti-smuggling police later managed to discover this man's employer. It was realized that the cross-border driver had already managed to transport 894 “obscene” books to Mainland China. Later, another group was discovered carrying out this type of smuggling, with networks in Zhuhai and Foshan, and which was linked to this employer. The group was dismantled by the authorities in June 2023. In turn, in August last year another man was discovered who maintained close contacts with this group and was also arrested. At that time, another group that circulated “obscene” books by sea was also dismantled. Smuggling | 18 cases in the last two weeks The Customs Service (SA) says it has discovered, in the last two weeks, 18 cases of smuggling at the Border Posts of Portas do Cerco and the Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau Bridge, between the 26th of September and the 9th of October. According to a SA statement, 991 old cell phones, 9.16 kilograms of undeclared food, nine bottles of Chinese liquor, 6006 grams of cigars and 68 cosmetic products were discovered by intercepted smugglers. The SA also reported that the smugglers are residents of Macau, Hong Kong and Mainland China, and were charged under the Foreign Trade Law.

item.title: IAS | Vulnerable families with second subsidy this month
item.description: The Institute of Social Action (IAS) will grant, this month, the second grant of a support subsidy for vulnerable families, the “Community Inclusion and Harmony Program”, in order to “help alleviate the life pressure of the three types of families in vulnerable situations”, such as single-parent families, families with disabled members and families with chronically ill people. Families that are beneficiaries of this IAS support can receive this month, simultaneously, “the regular subsidy and the special subsidy through bank transfer or in the previously established manner, with the total number of families benefiting from the two subsidies being 1,283”. In total, there are 6,128 families that meet the requirements of the “Regulation of the Program for Inclusion and Harmony in the Community”, which involves an expenditure of approximately 42.92 million patacas. In relation to the beneficiary families who submitted the request to the IAS or to the collaborating associations or institutions, and whose request was granted, the special subsidy will be granted to them from this Wednesday, 15th, through bank transfer or in cash, with the total number of beneficiary families in this context being 4,845. In a single-parent family, the special subsidy will amount to 2,650 patacas, while in a family of three the support is 5,500. In a family with eight or more people, the value rises to 10,100 patacas.

item.title: Suspicious transactions in casinos fall 9.5 percent until September
item.description: The number of suspicious transactions recorded in casinos fell by 9.5 percent in the first nine months of 2025, compared to the same period last year, according to official data. The Financial Information Office (GIF) reported that the six casino operators submitted, in total, 2,751 reports of transactions suspected of money laundering or terrorist financing. In a statement released on Thursday, GIF pointed to “the decrease in the number of reports of suspicious transactions reported by the gaming sector” until September as the main reason for an 8.9 percent drop in the total number. Between January and September, the office received 4,118 submissions, 73.3 percent of which came from casino concessionaires, while 21 percent came from banks and insurance companies and 5.7 percent from other institutions and entities. The referenced sectors, including pawn shops, jewelry stores, real estate agencies and auction houses, are obliged to report to the authorities any transaction equal to or greater than 500 thousand patacas. In 2024, GIF had received 5,245 participations, the majority of which came from the territory's casinos: 3,837, 11.8 percent more than in the previous year and a new record. Everyone agree According to GIF's annual report, Macau was the only member of the Asia-Pacific Anti-Money Laundering Group (FATF) that complied with “all 40 international standards” on preventing money laundering and the financing of terrorism and the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction. The office signed agreements to exchange information with 33 countries and territories, including the Financial Information Unit of the Judicial Police of Portugal, in 2008, the Financial Information Unit of the Central Bank of Timor-Leste, in 2018, and, in 2019, the Financial Activities Control Council of Brazil and the Financial Information Unit of Cape Verde. In July, GIF said that it had finalized the procedures to sign, also with Angola, an information exchange agreement to prevent money laundering and the financing of terrorism and the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction. The office said that the agreement was on the table at a meeting with representatives of the Financial Information Unit of the Republic of Angola, on the sidelines of the Egmont Group meeting between 6 and 11 July, in Luxembourg. The Egmont Group is an international anti-money laundering organization, which brings together 181 information units from around the world.

item.title: C-PLPEX and MIF take place on October 22nd
item.description: The Sino-Lusophone trade fair that opens on October 22 in Macau will feature more than 480 exhibitors from China and Portuguese-speaking countries, an increase of 60 percent, said the organization. The Trade and Investment Promotion Institute (IPIM) stated that the second edition of the Economic and Trade Exhibition of China and Portuguese-Speaking Countries (C-PLPEX) has as its theme “creating new opportunities for cooperation”. The inaugural edition of C-PLPEX, held in 2023, after six editions of the Exhibition of Products and Services of Portuguese-Speaking Countries, featured 300 companies, of which 260 came from Portuguese-speaking markets. In a statement, IPIM highlighted that exhibitors come from sectors such as agriculture, food and beverages, new energies, marine economy, cross-border e-commerce and professional services. In the case of agriculture, “innovative technologies will be presented, such as ‘drones’ [unmanned aircraft] and the use of waste”, along with “characteristic agricultural products and derivatives”, including coffee beans and cashews. Between October 22nd and 25th, C-PLPEX will also include “other links in the industrial chain, such as storage logistics and sales by agents”, highlighted IPIM. The new energy sector will prioritize “innovative products and services, including electric motorcycles, new energy space capsules, energy storage and solar energy systems”. Simultaneous with MIF The C-PLPEX program includes the launch of 13 new projects, the announcement of the winners of awards for wines and spirits and coffee from Portuguese-speaking countries and a networking session between agricultural entrepreneurs. The second edition of C-PLPEX will take place simultaneously with the 30th Macau International Fair (MIF) and the Macau 2025 Franchise Exhibition. This year, IPIM invited Guangzhou, capital of the neighboring province of Guangzhou, as a MIF partner city and will organize more than 50 economic and commercial promotion sessions, including regional cooperation forums and conferences. The organization said that 20 new products and technologies will be launched during MIF, which this year features new themed pavilions dedicated to the robotics industry as well as a pavilion dedicated to Macau's healthcare brands.

item.title: NBA | Peace resumed and return to Macau after six years
item.description:
The Venetian Arena was the stage for the NBA's historic return to China. And throughout the weekend, several celebrities such as David Beckham, Jackie Chan or Jack Ma were in the stands to watch the pre-season games
On Friday, around 14,000 people watched the first game between teams from the North American Basketball League (NBA) in China after six years of disruption. More than an hour and a half before the start of the match between the Brooklyn Nets and the Phoenix Suns, hundreds of fans were already queuing up to enter the Venetian Arena, which will host NBA pre-season games for five years. Although basketball is one of the most popular sports in China, the main motivation for those who came early was the various performances by musical groups from the interior of neighboring Hong Kong before the opening whistle. Neither team is tipped to succeed the Oklahoma City Thunder as NBA champions, but in the completely full stands, there seemed to be more fans of the Nets, who have Zeng Fanbo on their squad. The 22-year-old left the Beijing Ducks, from the Chinese capital, to sign in August with the Nets, owned by the president of Chinese technology giant Alibaba, Joe Tsai Chung-Hsin. Zeng was chosen to speak to the fans before kick-off and received one of the biggest ovations of the night when he first came on with three minutes remaining in the first half. With the ball rolling, the Nets dominated, reaching the break with an advantage (71-59), in a lukewarm match, despite a lot of noise made by the fans, especially with each 'dunk' or triple shot. Luxury assistance The organizers did their best to keep the atmosphere buzzing, even launching souvenirs attached to mini parachutes from the roof of the arena and the football world lent a helping hand, with former England international David Beckham sitting in the front row, alongside Hong Kong actor Jackie Chan, Joe Tsai and Alibaba founder Jack Ma. Timeouts were used to bring Chinese celebrities to the floor, including members of Hong Kong's most famous band, Mirror, or former NBA legends, including two former rivals: Shaquille O'Neal and Chinese Yao Ming. "I remember watching Yao Ming play for the [Houston] Rockets when I was little. But this was the first time I saw the NBA live. It was crazy!", she told Lusa Fang, 33 years old. This Suns fan, who flew two thousand kilometers from Beijing, was still hoarse after watching the team come back in the second half and win 132-127, after extra time, after more than three hours. The Nets have an opportunity to get revenge on Sunday, when the two teams meet again, in the same arena. More important than the result was the return to China. The NBA has not played games in China since 2019, when Daryl Morey, then general manager of the Houston Rockets, demonstrated support for anti-government protests in Hong Kong on social media. “Most of these fans unfortunately didn't have the opportunity to watch [NBA] games, but we gave them a show here and we felt supported,” said Nets coach Jordi Fernández after the game. The NBA refused to punish Daryl Morey, but Chinese state television CCTV stopped broadcasting American league games, a hiatus that cost $400 million in lost revenue. But the passion for basketball in China has not faded, said Suns star Devin Booker: “I haven't felt this level of passion in a long time (…). It was important for the NBA to come back here.”

item.title: ZELENSKY VS ZELENSKY
item.description:
10/27/22 A Ukrainian pensioner, with the same name as the president, blames Zelensky for the prolongation of the conflict that destroyed his village. Zelensky, the villager, who never left his land, is now mortified because his favorite gravedigger died in the bomber. This Zelensky, a villager, represents half the world that recriminates the other Zelensky, the villain, for not wanting to negotiate with Putin. Negotiate what? The invader enters our house, covers his wife and daughter (cf. recent UN report on the rapes in Ukraine, in this “special operation”), an act that forced us to watch, and then we say to him: hi there, we are for peace, but we have to negotiate: you still haven't said what name you want to give the children! A peace that is not dignified is nothing more than a cessation of rights. As serious as the Russophobia that Putin inflicts on his people.
10/28/22 At a lunch with several guests, I heard a friend, who declared herself a spiritualist, explaining the particularities of her belief, in a calm and balanced way, I would even say, without a hint of “irrationalism”. He spoke at length and serenely, devoid of any fanatical proselytism. “Here is someone whose belief has brought thoughtfulness!” I thought, a rare alliance. However, at a certain moment a sentence comes out that horrifies me. It says, “there is no chance, nothing happens by chance!”, and I glimpse the voracious maws of holism. Because holism has a pathological aspect, like all good things, a shadow side. Two examples: in Hinduism there is less sensitivity to existential dramas, if that child suffers in this life this is just an expression of rigorous karmic symmetry, an effect of the acts he committed in his previous life. In Africa, it is not accepted that death could have been accidental, and many women are accused by the family of the deceased of having caused the death of their husband, in an act of manifest dementia, and, in the blatant majority of cases, a huge injustice for the wife — madness that spreads and infiltrates the social fabric. Buddhism introduced Compassion and Christianity introduced Caritas, trying to break with this logic, but in many other beliefs and religions the cage of causalities prevails over sensitivity to experience, the need to respond to the now. It is a tremendous logic that transforms the world into a Platonic stage, where we are nothing more than the shadows of something — an inextricable law -, in a determinism that calcifies all singularities, but that strangely fascinates many. The conquest of modernity was anchored in the conquest of chance and randomness, removing the incidences of a life from this fierce determinism that enclosed the world in a web. When the Renaissance freed the body from the influence of the stars, at that moment sexuality was relieved of guilt and individualism and its volition were able to emerge. There is an unequivocal moral implication in the phrase “there is no such thing as chance, nothing happens by chance!”, which should function as a key to self-knowledge and self-judgment, however, this phrase is usually used to seek a reason for things outside of us, in others. It's an alibi. Today there is a holistic temptation in the world, just as there was a satanic temptation in the Middle Ages, without much reflection on its consequences. Because it's not enough to want to connect everything in a resonant chain of affection. Even for the most unexpected: affection itself can kill. I realize, thanks to that cultured, balanced, intelligent woman, that “the fight” took place at the beginning of this century. One of the great mistakes of the 20th century was the false dichotomy between “rationalism and irrationalism”, a debate that extended to all fields, including art. First, rationality (the positive side of reason) was confused with rationalism (the pathological aspect of reason), and articulated in this lack of discernment, irrationalism was confused with freedom. Almost all 20th century art, with Surrealism at its head, made this mistake. The fallacy still exists despite the emergence of “irrationalism” and the consequent relativist currents that followed it having been consolidated everywhere. Essentially, much of what happened in the 20th century revolved around this clash between two paradigms: Rationalism versus Irationalism. Now, I see, we must save indeterminacy, chance, randomness from the terrible temptation of the cage of causalities. Holism, in its pathological form, may be reductionism that sets itself up as a new “eschatological narrative”. Is it “by chance” that holism emerges at a time when neo-liberalism and its cynical contempt for the human person is besieging everything, all freedoms, all acquired rights? Holistic awareness has brought a positive impact to greater ecological awareness, but followed with scholastic rigor, it stifles reality under the blanket of a determinism that is much more than uncomfortable: all great authoritarian ideologies are holistic. My friend will know how to combine her holistic and transpersonal belief with the freedom and responsibility that each moment asks of us — but how many will make the distinction, under a Law that explains and encompasses everything? How many will abandon themselves to what is? The awareness of the indeterminate brings tragic awareness, as the Greeks knew, but it also brings agency and the courage of decision. And we cannot give up on this. Furthermore, as Drummond shows in the poem “Quadrilha”, by Carlos Drummond de Andrade: «João loved Teresa who loved Raimundo/ who loved Maria who loved Joaquim who loved Lili/ who didn't love anyone./ João went to the United States, Teresa to the convent,/ Raimundo died of a disaster, Maria stayed with her aunt,/ Joaquim committed suicide and Lili married J. Pinto Fernandes/ who had not entered the story.» Real always runs outside the track, completely outside our concepts. That's what matters to us — a J. Pinto Fernandes emerges at the exact moment when we thought we had everything under control.

item.title: From Nobel and others
item.description: 9/10/22 When reading many people's reactions when this year's Nobel Prize for Literature was announced, I couldn't help but remember this comment from Jean-Pierre Siméon, in relation to another Nobel Prize: «An editor of a large national daily newspaper wrote five lines of indignation at the fact that the Nobel Prize for Literature had been awarded to Thomas Traströmer, a complete stranger. But unknown to whom? How did it not occur to this literary columnist, patented and paid to do his job, that his apparent ignorance was a matter of professional misconduct? Tranströmer had been translated into many languages, it was available in French.» There is always the chorus of those who wait for the Prize to be announced to complain about not having been invited to be on the jury, there is a subgroup of angry people who profess “I have never read it and I won’t even bother to read it”; It is a less than humble fauna, the one that inhabits social networks. I don't always know all the winners – I didn't know about the existence of Louise Glück, who I think is a great poet, or Olga Tokarczuk, for example – but this only brings me the comfort of knowing that the world is not a soap opera where everyone knows everyone else and the joy of recognizing that the yardstick of the world is not measured with my short measure and that, on the contrary, it gives me a new opportunity to face the unknown and learn from it. And perhaps the most stupid reaction was that of the intelligent man who wrote, But are there still people who read French?; simply confirming that today there is a new type of ignorance that is being raised with abandon: that of those who only read English. I would also prefer that, in French, Pascal Quignard, Linda Lê or even Sollers were awarded, or, among the new ones, Mathias Énard, but that does not detract from the dignity of Annie Ernaux's work (and it would have been enough to have written “Les Années”). There are books of hers that I like less, like the vulgar “Uma Paixão Simples”, but that happens with almost all authors, they have pivotal books and others that are like breaks in their itinerary. I recommend reading a beautiful book of interviews with her, “L’écriture comme un couteau”. 11/10/22 Yesterday an article appeared in the morning newspaper “Notícias”, in Maputo, reporting that the Pen Club Narrative Prize had been awarded to my wife, Teresa Noronha, for her soap opera “Tornado”, which had already won the Maria Velho da Costa Prize. The summary they made of the book does not even deserve comments, as it is pathetic, but what is important to highlight is the note of disqualification regarding its “Mozambicanness” when they call it Luso-Mozambican. It's not that it's inaccurate, but, for those who know the context, it's a touch naughty. Because finally, following the same logic, Adelino Timóteo should be called Tsonga-Mozambican, Álvaro Taruma Ronga-Mozambican, and Macua-Mozambican for writers from the north, etc., etc. Which doesn't appear to happen. At one point, in the novel, she writes: «Our color was never the dominant one. In colonial times we were not white, we were dressed in monhés, mugs of washed asses, the pejorative term to speak of a son of Goan and Portuguese. In the post-colonial period, I was not black and if, in Lisbon, they took me for Brazilian or Cape Verdean, in France they were lost in thought about where I was from and were surprised when they discovered that I was African. There I had to explain the wanderings of my DNA before settling in Mozambique. It took me a long time to accept that it was like that because yes, and that it was no curse that that was the case; on the contrary, I could even discover intense patterns of fantasy and freedom in this harlequin cloak that is our genealogy…” In modern-day Mozambique, it means being white… and that immediately takes precedence over what you do or what you are. It's sad, but as Naipaul warned, in these parts race is everything and people live as deeply immersed in it as, in other places, in religion. 12/10/22 Bruno Latour, an anthropologist who studied the sciences and their procedures and legitimations, law, technique and religions and who entertained himself by turning his back on the dogmas of the “moderns”, has died. For him, the place, the role of the specialist, was defined more by the perplexity he embodied than by the supposed truth that would sustain him. He proposed, as an alternative to the goodness of multiculturalism and its equivocal cliché “all different, all equal”, a return to “diplomacy”, given that this, precisely, does not start from the assumption that “we are unified because we share the same nature” but simply highlights that we “still do not share a common world”; It is necessary that we deal head-on with the “abyss of disagreement” that separates us, instead of trying to deceive it. And about politics he said, boldly: «If transparency is demanded from politicians, we kill them; if anyone demands fidelity to what the other was or what he says, kill him; If a mimetic relationship is required between what the crowd wants and what its representative says, representation is killed. These must therefore, by definition, betray, deceive, modify, distort the word. Without this ability to bend the word and betray, political language would not exist. I put forward the perfectly plausible hypothesis that political vocabulary will become as inaccessible as the religious language of the last twenty, three or fifty years.» (in “Un Monde Pluriel mais Commun”). I believe we will be needed to decipher this frantically complex world that has fallen to us.

item.title: Fuxi
item.description: O my friends, companions of these disastrous journeys through countries as old as the stars and the Moon, and as strange as the deepest interior of our wretched souls, what surprises still await us, what secret magics will we still have to overcome, what horrors will arise before our pupils dilated with astonishment and terror? Increasingly closer to our precarious existences, howls the monster of war, which threatens to merge humanity once and for all with the earth, incessantly traversed by the squalid specter of hunger and the invisible evil of ten thousand pestilences. Oh damned human, who believes you are superior to Nature itself, but then you reveal yourself, time and time again, incapable of simply ordering your existence and do not understand that you are possessed by fickle anger and are a slave to your own ambition! You are not satisfied with white jade or resplendent gold, there is no treasure that quenches your inextinguishable thirst for command over other men, animals and things; for eternal anguish dwells in you; in you the expelled serpents crawl; for you grows, powerful and impressive, the most fertile ivy of Evil! This is perhaps why on the Mount they call the White Deer, where one of the eight immortals on a sacred mount soared through the heavens towards Penglai, lives the fuxi, a bird whose shape resembles that of a rooster, although topped by a human head. What strange copulations, what monstrous embraces, what terrible procedures must have occurred to make the existence of this sinister animal possible? We don't know, but all it takes is for our exhausted mind to dare to come up with an answer, and then we feel our skin covered in horrendous goosebumps and our heart races in parade, like a wild horse whipped by the night whip of fear, unresponsive to reins and containment. Men should refrain from visiting Monte do Veado, because although there are riches capable of calming the wildest ambitions, if they have the unfortunate luck of catching a glimpse of a fuxi, it is certain that a war will soon break out and the cultivated fields will perish because of it, tame animals will be beheaded, because of it the best young men of two generations will be sacrificed and the land will be destroyed. pride of countries. The fuxi makes a sound reminiscent of its name. If you hear it, dark night or clear day, be on your way, because the path you are on is the surest path to misfortune!

item.title: Procrastinators Club
item.description: While rereading Easter, because of an article I'm preparing, I come across this excerpt, taken from “The Universal Man”: «Each man, morally, is one and absolute; but he has to live with attenuating his personality. (…) Coexistence is only possible between people reduced to a negative or hollow presence, which constantly gives way. Hence, the emptiness of society, an immense ghost made up of countless dead people. A superior man is antisocial or criminal. His destiny is prison and the desert”. I hesitate to think whether Pascoaes reflects here on the political-social conditions that muzzle, and, worse, in a sad country like Portugal in the middle of the Estado Novo (and the book is from 1931) where any possibilities of spontaneity and frankness in human relationships were limited, or if it simply lends to the behavior of (oppressed) men a metaphysical framework, an “essence”, declared in the presumption of each one. to be, in isolation, “one and absolute”. Sometimes, in addition to an excess of Spirituality (or Saudade), Pascoaes lacks the world. He is a great poet, but he is a poet who takes Ampoules-of-Great-Ideas and who therefore writes often trapped by a programmatic furor, ceasing to have pores; It is not uncommon for a glass to be erected between him and reality, the same glass that made him write in O Bailado, from 1921: «Everything is a ghost. There are only clouds, clouds of voices, clouds of souls, of afflictions and tragedies! Clouds and more clouds, appearances and more appearances! And a divine lightning that pierces them, the instantaneous Apparition that appears and throws us to the ground, dazzled!» Sometimes I felt like reminding him, as António Sérgio did, in the article “Regeneration and Tradition, Moral and Economy”, which he dedicated to Pascoaes: «Pascoais, Pascoais my dear friend: you are a pure, excellent and noble poet, but also a victim of this social environment, like us all: of this horrible isolation that you praise and I curse». «As a child, he stole two blackbirds», says Jacinto do Prado Coelho, he stole them from a nest, and he felt remorse for that all his life. The Person, few more mischiefs are known to him. Only in Álvaro de Campos does a hint of wickedness and obscenity emerge: «Ah, and the ordinary and dirty people, who always look the same,/ Who use swear words as usual words,/ Whose sons steal from grocery store doors/ And whose daughters at the age of eight – and I think this is beautiful and I love it! –/ Decent-looking men masturbate in stairwells.” (Triumphal ode). Both poets, driven by a certain idea of ​​sanctity, had the same inability to break the siege of their skin with the overflow of someone else's dam, the same curse of sublimating the concrete ferocity of eros with the gentleness of the verses. Obviously, they are both “bigger than life”, but sometimes it makes me unnerved to watch, from my position as a hatter at the Procrastinators Club, the tantrums between them, just to see who occupies, in the internal organization, the place of President and Treasurer. Although Pessoa guessed more things, for example, what he wrote in the lesser-known Ode Martial and which is reflected in the situation we live in today, in a different way, with his heart in his hands: «MARTIAL ODE (…) Helahoho! helahoho! The poor widow's sewing machine who was bayoneted... She sewed indefinitely in the afternoon… The table where the old people played, Everything mixed, everything mixed with bodies, with blood, All one river, one wave, one dragging horror. Helahoho! helahoho! I unearthed the child's tin train pressed into the middle of the [road, And I cried like all the mothers in the world about the horror of life. My pantheistic feet tripped over the sewing machine [widow who was killed with a bayonet And that poor instrument of peace stuck a spear in my heart. Yes, I was the one to blame for everything, I was the soldier for them all Who killed, raped, burned and broke, It was me and my shame and my remorse like a shadow [misshapen They travel around the world like Ashavero, But behind my steps there are footsteps the size of infinity And a physical fear of being accountable to God makes me close my eyes. [eyes suddenly. (…) I ordered, captain, to shoot the trembling peasants, I let the daughters of all fathers tied to trees be raped, Now I saw that it was inside my heart that all this happened, And everything scalds and suffocates and I can't move without it [everything be the same. God have mercy on me, I didn't have it from anyone! LÀ-BAS, JE NE SAIS OÙ…” What is clear today, at this disastrous moment in which Cristiano & Companhia failed in their mission in Braga, and in which the self-sabotage of Russia's gas pipelines reminds us that Putin will indeed be willing to do anything to maintain dominance over the areas endorsed, is that, bomb for bomb, the “bomb” of the Fifth Empire was preferable.
